value.title: DAX Fridays! #82: How to learn DAX for beginners
value.excerpt: So you want to know which path to take to learn DAX and you want to use my DAX Fridays! videos? No problem, in this video, I have put together a list of the order you could follow to learn DAX based on the function difficulties, the common needs on the report and your previous experience.  But before

value.title: DAX Fridays! #84: Get values from another table with inactive relationships
value.excerpt: It is world's cup fever: FIFA world cup 2018 in Russia!!! And we dont want to miss anything right?  That is where Power BI comes to the rescue :)  I am going to build a Power BI file to follow the world cup and I decided to show you how I create it while creating it :)  In the first video, I downloaded

value.title: DAX Fridays! #90: Understanding LOOKUPVALUES error
value.excerpt: Have you got the following error when using the DAX function LOOKUPVALUES?  "A table of multiple values was supplied where a single value was expected"  in this video, I will show you why that error happens and what you need to do to resolve it and use the function as intended. value.title: DAX Fridays! #91: Sum child values into the parent
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to sum child values into the parent when you are dealing with hierarchies in Power BI.  This video is based on an example shown in the previous DAX Fridays! video, so I recommend you to watch that first: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e8OWQ7Xl3m0  Happy holidays!

value.title: DAX Fridays! #95: Binning, Frequency and relative frequency | Data profiler
value.excerpt: This is the first of a series of videos about data profiling and descriptive statistics. In today's video, I will show you how to bin data,  calculate the frequency and relative frequency using DAX.  What you think about the series? let me know in the comment box.  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/median-dax-functions

value.title: DAX Fridays! #96: MEDIAN, AVERAGE, MEAN, MODE | The Bill Gates Effect
value.excerpt: In part 2 of the data profiling series, we are going to talk about MEAN, AVERAGE, MODE AND MEDIAN and try to explain them with a story, what I call the Bill Gates Effect.  Main topics?  Is average a good measure ? When is average a bad metric to use? Calculate median Calculate mode.  Here is the website

value.title: DAX Fridays! #97: STANDARD DEVIATION EXPLAINED | Who is the best player, LeBron or Durant?
value.excerpt: Who is the best player, Duran or LeBron? Let's find out using statistics and standard deviation. value.title: After Union Two tables, data goes to the wrong column with Power BI DAX?
value.excerpt: Most of us have used Union DAX expression in Power BI. Basically union, appends rows from both the table which are common. In Power BI, sometimes, when we perform Union operation, the combined data have some inconsistent mechanism, meaning one column's data merged with another column. The main reason

value.title: Find and Remove Last Occurrence from a String using Power BI DAX
value.excerpt: During this session, we will learn how we can find and remove last occurrence from a string using Power BI DAX. This is equivalent to Text Before Delimitator property in Power Query. value.title: Combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX. Just a little bit of DAX! This can be useful when you want to use a single report tooltip for multiple Power BI visuals.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Tracing your DAX queries in Power BI

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop

This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. I thought it is good to explain it in a set of videos, the first one here is about what the TreatAs function is and how it can help to build filters and a virtual relationship between two tables. Let's see how you can use this function.

value.title: Create a subset of the table in Power BI and add calculations using SELECTCOLUMNS DAX Function
value.excerpt: Previously I explained the AddColumns function as a function that adds one or more columns to the existing table, In this article and video, I'll explain another similar and useful function with slightly different behavior: SelectColumns, and you will learn how you can use it in Power BI and DAX.
